topic.title: RF Decoupling Capacitors on NPU and GFX Power Planes

section.p: It is recommended to have placeholders for high-frequency decoupling capacitors on the VCCNPU (NPU power plane) and VCCGT (GFX power plane). These decoupling capacitors may help in reducing potential NPU and GFX noise in certain scenarios such as a system with aggressive antenna placement to NPU and GFX power planes. The following table and figure show the recommended values and placement for the decoupling capacitors:

entry.p: Directly underneath pair of NPU / GFX power via and GND vias (Directly from BGAs) on the plane
0201 size: 6 x capacitors (Suggested value: between 22pF to 33pF)
0201 size: 6 x capacitors (Suggested value: between 22pF to 33pF)

Preferred placement for RF decoupling capacitors.Capacitors are recommended to be placed directly underneath the pair of NPU / GFX power via - GND vias at bottom layer or at least within the CPU’s shadow area. The value of the RF capacitor may need to be tuned with respect to the potential unintended RF power within Wi-Fi bands.
≤ 5mm from NPU / GFX power via BGA

0201 size: 6 x capacitors (Suggested value: between 22pF to 33pF)
